page.title: 14CHISLEHURST'S LOCAL WILDLIFE
page.content: On week days I live with my granny.In her garden there are lots of trees. Many birds come into the garden and sometimes they come up to you. I have seen collard doves, wrens, tiny birds which are quite rare and hardly ever seen, wood pigeons,robins, starlings, crows, ravens which,when they walk on the roof sound like burglars. I have also seen magpies, jays, blue tits, great tits and finches.I have even seen a linnet.In Chislehurst woods you can always spot a grey squirrel in any season of the year. In Elmstead woods foxes are common-they go into peoples back gardens and feed from their dustbins. They can become quite tame. Our school secretary has a tame fox and she often feeds it by hand.
